name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: [SOUND]

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _In this lecture
column6: we continue the discussion of Vector Space Model. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _In particular
column6: we are going to talk about the TF transformation. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _In the previous lecture

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: we have derived a TF-IDF weighting formula using the vector space model.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And we have shown that this model actually works pretty well for

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _these examples as shown on this slide except for d5

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: which has received a very high score.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Indeed
column6: it has received the highest score among all these documents. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _But this document is intuitively non-relevant
column6: so this is not desirable. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _In this lecture
column6: we're going to talk about how would you use TF _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: transformation to solve this problem.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Before we discuss the details
column6: let's take a look at the formula for _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: this symbol here for IDF weighting ranking function and

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: see why this document has received such a high score.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So this is the formula
column6: and if you look at the formula carefully

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: then you will see it involves a sum over all the matched query terms.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _And inside the sum
column6: each matched query sum has a particular weight. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And this weight is TF-IDF weighting.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: So it has an IDF component where we see 2 variables.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _One is the total number of documents in the collection
column6: and that is m. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: The other is the documentive frequency.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: This is the number of documents that contain this word w.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _The other variables in
column6: involving the formula

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: include the count of the query term.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _W in the query
column6: and the count of the word in the document. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _If you look at this document again
column6: now it's not hard to _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: realize that the reason why it has received a high score is because

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: it has a very high count of campaign.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So the count of campaign in this document is a four
column6: which is much higher than _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _the other documents
column6: and has contributed to the high score of this document. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So intriguingly
column6: in order to lower the score for this document

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _to somehow restrict the contribution of
column6: the matching of this term in the document. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And if you think about the matching of terms in the document carefully you

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: actually would realize we probably shouldn't reward

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: multiple occurrences so generously.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _And by that I mean the first occurrence of a term says a lot about the

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _the matching of this term
column6: because it goes from zero count _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _to a count of one
column6: and that increase means a lot. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Once we see a word in the document

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: it's very likely that the document is talking about this word.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _If we see an extra occurrence on top of the first occurrence

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _that is to go from one to two
column6: then we also can say that well

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: occurrence kind of confirmed that it's not a accidental mention of the word.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Now
column6: we are more sure that this document is talking about this word. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _But imagine we have seen
column6: let's say
column7: 50 times of the word in the document. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Then
column6: adding one extra occurrence is not going to test more about _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: evidence because we are already sure that this document is about this word.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: So if you're thinking this way it seems that

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: we should restrict the contributing of a high account of term.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And that is the idea of TF Transformation.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: So this transformation function is going to turn the raw count of word

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _into a Term Frequency Weight
column6: for the word in the document. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So here I show in x-axis
column6: that raw count

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: and in y-axis I show the Term Frequency Weight.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So
column6: in the previous ranking functions we actually have increasingly

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: used some kind of transformation.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: So for example in the zero-one bit vector retentation we actually use

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: the Suchier transformation function as shown here.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Basically if the count is zero then it has zero weight.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Otherwise it would have a weight of one.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: It's flat.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Now what about using Term Count as a TF weight.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Well that's a linear function
column6: right? _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: So it has just exactly the same weight as the count.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Now we have just seen that this is not desirable.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: So what we want is something like this.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So for example with a logarithm function

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: we can have a sub-linear transformation that looks like this.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And this will control the influence of really high weight because it's going to

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _lower its inference
column6: yet it will retain the inference of small count. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Or we might want to even bend the curve more by applying logarithm twice.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Now people have tried all these methods and they are indeed working better than

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _the linear form of the transformation
column6: but so far what works the best _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: seems to be this special transformation called a BM25 transformation.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: BM stands for best matching.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Now in this transformation
column6: you can see there's a parameter k here. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And this k controls the upper bound of this function.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: It's easy to see this function has a upper bound because if you look at

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _the x divided by x plus k where k is not an active number

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _then the numerator will never be able to exceed the denominator
column6: right? _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So
column6: it's upper bounded by k plus 1. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Now
column6: this is also difference between this transformation function and _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: the logarithm transformation.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Which it doesn't have upperbound.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Now furthermore
column6: one interesting property of this function is that as we vary K

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _we can actually simulate different transformation functions

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: including the two extremes that are shown here.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _That is a zero one bit transformation
column6: and the unit transformation. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So for example
column6: if we set k to zero

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: the function value would be one.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So we precisely
column6: recover the zero one bit transformation. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _If you set k to a very large number
column6: on the other hand

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _other hand
column6: it's going to look more like the linear transformation function. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So in this sense
column6: this transformation is very flexible

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: it allows us to control the shape of the transformation.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: It also has a nice property of the upper bound.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And this upper bound is useful to control the inference of a particular term.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _And so that we can prevent a
column6: a spammer from just increasing the count of _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: 1 term to spam all queries that might match this term.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: In other words this upper bound might also ensure that all terms

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _will be counted when we aggregate the
column6: the weights

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _As I said
column6: this transformation function has worked well

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _So to summarise this lecture

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: the main point is that we need to do some sub linearity of TF Transformation.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And this is needed to capture the intuition of diminishing return from

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: high Term Counts.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: It's also to avoid a dominance by one single term over all others.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _This BM25 Transformation
column6: Transformation that we talked about is very interesting. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: It's so far one of the best performing TF Transforming formation formulas.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _It has upper bound
column6: and it's also robust and effective. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _Now
column6: if we're plug in this function into our TF-IDF weighting _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: vector space model then we would end up having the following

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: _ranking function
column6: which has a BM25 TF component. _

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: Now this is already very close to a state

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: of the art ranking function called a BM25.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: And we will discuss how we can further improve this formula in the next lecture.

name: 2 - 8 - 1.8 TF Transformation (00-09-31).srt
text: [MUSIC]
